body.title: Purpose of the project
body.text:
This project was completed in the first year of Epitech.

Sokoban is a type of transport puzzle, in which a player pushes boxes in a warehouse in an attempt to move them to storage locations.

The game is played on a grid of squares, where each square is either a floor or a wall. Some floor squares contain boxes and others are marked as storage locations.

The player is confined to the grid and can move horizontally or vertically on empty squares (never through walls or boxes).

The player can also enter a box, which pushes it into the next square.

Boxes cannot be pushed into other boxes or walls, and they cannot be pulled.

The puzzle is solved when all boxes are at storage locations.

body.title: Functioning
body.text:
We had to create the sokoban version terminal with the player moving using the arrow keys. The program starts with a map (puzzle) containing:

  • # The walls of the map
  • P The character
  • O The storage locations
  • X The boxes to be moved
